items.title: May in Brussels to urge short Brexit delay
items.description: The PM heads to an EU summit, hours after a speech telling the nation she was "on their side".
items.content:
Image copyrightEPAImage caption
 In a speech on Wednesday, Mrs May told the nation she does not support a long delay to Brexit
Theresa May will make a direct plea to EU leaders later asking to postpone Brexit for three months, hours after telling the Britis… [+6156 chars]

items.author: BBC News
items.title: Dutch populists make senate gains - exit poll
items.description: The anti-immigration Forum for Democracy looks set to be the second biggest party in the upper house.
items.content:
Image copyrightEPAImage caption
 Thierry Baudet is a critic of the EU and of the Netherlands' immigration policies
The governing centre-right coalition in the Netherlands is set to lose its senate majority after a populist party surged in provincial electio… [+1675 chars]

items.author: BBC News
items.title: Melting glaciers reveal Everest bodies
items.description: The remains of mountaineers who died on the world's highest peak are being exposed as its ice melts.
items.content:
Image copyrightFrank BienewaldImage caption
 Most of the dead bodies of mountaineers have appeared on the Khumbu glacier
Expedition operators are concerned at the number of climbers' bodies that are becoming exposed on Mount Everest as its glaciers melt.
N… [+4904 chars]

items.author: BBC News
items.title: Top Scores
items.description: From Pong to Red Dead: How video game music has always played players
items.content:
While the Sonic palette available to games composers had improved, the music itself was still linear - playing alongside the action, rather than reacting to it. If a musical cue pinged when the player ponged, it was through serendipity, not design. 
Adaptive… [+3867 chars]

items.author: BBC News
items.title: NZ to ban all military style weapons - PM
items.description: New Zealand will ban all types of semi-automatic weapons used in Christchurch attacks, says PM Jacinda Ardern.
items.content:
New Zealand will ban all types of semi-automatic weapons used in Christchurch attacks, says PM Jacinda Ardern.
The country's gun laws have been in the spotlight since a gunman killed 50 people at two mosques last Friday.
This breaking news story is being up… [+246 chars]

items.title: 'It has become an inland sea'
items.description: The BBC's Fergal Keane went to Mozambique to assess the devastation caused by Cyclone Idai.

items.author: BBC News
items.title: Rescuers race to reach cyclone survivors
items.description: Aid workers say thousands in Mozambique are still awaiting rescue from catastrophic flooding.
items.content:
Media captionCyclone Idai: Survivors rescued by land and air
Aid agencies are scrambling to reach survivors of Cyclone Idai in Mozambique as the full scale of the disaster becomes clear.

items.title: 'Why are the children being punished?'
items.description: Russian officials are facing appeals from hundreds of families to bring back IS wives and children.

items.author: BBC News
items.title: Forty-five snakes found under Texas house
items.description: A man called for help after spotting a few snakes. When the professionals arrived, they found a lot more.
items.content: VideoA man called for help after spotting a few snakes underneath his home. When the professionals arrived, they found a lot more.

items.content:

 Mr Trump made the remarks during a visit to a tank factory in Ohio
US President Donald Trump has attacked the late Senator John McCain, complaining that he "didn't get a thank you" for his state funeral.
